channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Trump is pushing Senate GOP to get his megabill across the finish line
item.description: President Trump is gearing up for what a senior White House official said will be an "all-out advocacy effort" to push Republican senators to advance the bill their House colleagues passed last month.
item.content:encoded:
President Trump is gearing up for what a senior White House official said will be an "all-out advocacy effort" to push Republican senators to advance the bill their House colleagues passed last month.

(Image credit: Alex Wroblewski)
item.dc:creator: Tamara Keith

item.title: Do you sing to your baby? NPR wants to know what songs you sing
item.description: A new study from Yale University finds that singing to babies improves their overall mood. NPR wants to know what songs our listeners sing to their babies.
item.content:encoded:
A new study from Yale University finds that singing to babies improves their overall mood. NPR wants to know what songs our listeners sing to their babies.

(Image credit: Joao Inacio)
item.dc:creator: Iman Maani

item.title: Russia and Ukraine Meet Following Massive Attacks
item.description: Representatives from Russia and Ukraine gather for peace talks in Istanbul. The meeting comes after the two countries each launched large-scale drone attacks on one another over the weekend, including an audacious Ukrainian strike on Russia's bomber aircraft fleet. We hear the latest from the talks and about how Ukraine's drone capabilities have evolved.
item.content:encoded: Representatives from Russia and Ukraine gather for peace talks in Istanbul. The meeting comes after the two countries each launched large-scale drone attacks on one another over the weekend, including an audacious Ukrainian strike on Russia's bomber aircraft fleet. We hear the latest from the talks and about how Ukraine's drone capabilities have evolved.
item.dc:creator: Charles Maynes

item.title: A runway under construction at Newark's beleaguered airport reopens early
item.description: U.S. Transportation Secretary Sean Duffy praised airport officials, unions and workers for completing the estimated 60-day project 13 days early. The Newark airport has been hobbled by delays.
item.content:encoded:
U.S. Transportation Secretary Sean Duffy praised airport officials, unions and workers for completing the estimated 60-day project 13 days early. The Newark airport has been hobbled by delays.

(Image credit: Kena Betancur)
item.dc:creator: Joe Hernandez

item.title: Raids and revenge tips: Inside ICE's Puerto Rico deportation operation
item.description: Rebecca González runs one of ICE's local domestic intelligence offices. She told NPR how her agents are tracking down immigrants in Puerto Rico to deliver on President Trump's mass deportation promise.
item.content:encoded:
Rebecca González runs one of ICE's local domestic intelligence offices. She told NPR how her agents are tracking down immigrants in Puerto Rico to deliver on President Trump's mass deportation promise.

(Image credit: Adrian Florido)
item.dc:creator: Adrian Florido

item.title: Trump's budget calls for a 15% funding cut to the Education Department
item.description: New details of the administration's budget proposal for fiscal year 2026 came after a federal judge blocked the president's efforts to close the U.S. Education Department.
item.content:encoded:
New details of the administration's budget proposal for fiscal year 2026 came after a federal judge blocked the president's efforts to close the U.S. Education Department.

(Image credit: Allison Robbert)
item.dc:creator: Cory Turner

item.title: Homeland Security pulls down list of 'sanctuary' cities and counties after backlash
item.description: The list included dozens of cities and counties that DHS said was in noncompliance with federal statutes and had come under intense criticism from some mayors and law enforcement.
item.content:encoded:
The list included dozens of cities and counties that DHS said was in noncompliance with federal statutes and had come under intense criticism from some mayors and law enforcement.

(Image credit: Kevin Carter)
item.dc:creator: Ximena Bustillo

item.title: A Manson Family member was recommended for parole again. But she's not free just yet
item.description: Patricia Krenwinkel was 21 when she participated in the August 1969 murders. Her parole recommendation would need to be approved by Gov. Gavin Newsom, who rejected the last one in 2022.
item.content:encoded:
Patricia Krenwinkel was 21 when she participated in the August 1969 murders. Her parole recommendation would need to be approved by Gov. Gavin Newsom, who rejected the last one in 2022.

(Image credit: George Brich)
item.dc:creator: Rachel Treisman

item.title: Mount Etna erupts, shooting a massive ash cloud into the sky and raising alerts
item.description: Mount Etna produced a spectacularly explosive eruption Monday, sending a ripple of reddish clouds down from the southeast summit of Europe's highest active volcano.
item.content:encoded:
Mount Etna produced a spectacularly explosive eruption Monday, sending a ripple of reddish clouds down from the southeast summit of Europe's highest active volcano.

(Image credit: Giuseppe Distefano)
item.dc:creator: Bill Chappell

item.title: Months after a martial law crisis, South Koreans will elect a new president
item.description: Whoever is elected, the new president will have little time for celebration.
item.content:encoded:
Whoever is elected, the new president will have little time for celebration.

(Image credit: Daniel Ceng)
item.dc:creator: Se Eun Gong
